title: How to Boil, Peel and Mash Potatoes at Home

steps.headline: Select some raw potatoes.
steps.description:

steps.headline: Add some water and potatoes in a pressure cooker.
steps.description: Place it on a gas stove and turn it on.

steps.headline: After three whistles, turn off the gas stove.
Remove the lid from the pressure cooker.
Remove the potatoes from the hot water and place them in a plate.
Place one of the potatoes in the right hand.
steps.description: Make a small hole with the help of the tips of the two fingers.

steps.headline: Move the peel to the opposite side from the place where you started off.
Remove the entire outer covering from the potato.
Hold the potato in one hand and press it lightly to break it into pieces.
Apply little more pressure and mash them completely.

text:
Select some raw potatoes. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/f3\/Potatoes.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/f\/f3\/Potatoes.jpg\/275px-Potatoes.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"275","bigHeight":"183","licensing":"

Image from: Flickr<\/a>
Taken by: Katie Munoz<\/a>
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Add some water and potatoes in a pressure cooker. Place it on a gas stove and turn it on. After three whistles, turn off the gas stove. Remove the lid from the pressure cooker. Remove the potatoes from the hot water and place them in a plate. Place one of the potatoes in the right hand. Make a small hole with the help of the tips of the two fingers. Move the peel to the opposite side from the place where you started off. Remove the entire outer covering from the potato. Peel the other potatoes also. Hold the potato in one hand and press it lightly to break it into pieces. Apply little more pressure and mash them completely.
